page.title: 20SUMMARY AND CREDITS
page.content: Some of us have been very surprised to find such a varied and attractive area on the doorstep of the New Town.Though so many footpaths and hedges have been removed,and with the decline in local dairying,the area still retains a surprising area of trees and bushes all contributingto the landscape.Seen from the main road in winter the area looks dreary and exposed,but in early summer,from within,all is different. Most of the fieldwork was done in early June by pupils in Remove and U1 St Nicholas School.Help from parents and relatives is acknowledged with thanks,also the varied contributions of West Essex Farmers,Latton Priory Farm,Takeleys Farm,Harlow Council leisure services,Essex Gliding Club and the Blacksmiths Arms.Many other individual contributions were made- our thanks for these too.
